div.p: A few weeks back, Bright Lights Film Journal published an article of mine—the first of my writings on classic Hollywood that I have published elsewhere.

blockquote.em: The untold story of how the screen comedy queen of the 1930s and ‘40s nearly become one of very few women to direct feature films in postwar Hollywood.

img.title: Claudette Colbert with camera
img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

div.p: Please follow the link to Bright Lights Film Journal and read the article.

It was inspired when I ran across the 1949 headline below several years ago—only to find out that I could not read the full story behind this Louella Parsons item because no one had written it! Eventually I decided to do it myself. I hope you enjoy it.
Please let me know your thoughts, either in a comment here or at Bright Lights Film Journal or at my Bluesky account.
